perturbation.original_text: Hereinafter referred to as "Customer" And FLEXTRONICS ISRAEL LTD. with a principal place of business at Industrial Zone Migdal Haemek 23108 P.O.B. 867, Israel. Hereinafter referred to as "Contractor."
perturbation.changed_text: Hereinafter referred to as "Client" And FLEXTRONICS ISRAEL LTD. with a principal place of business at Industrial Zone Migdal Haemek 23108 P.O.B. 867, Israel. Hereinafter referred to as "Service Provider."
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Customer' to 'Client' and 'Contractor' to 'Service Provider' introduces ambiguity. The rest of the document refers to 'Customer' and 'Contractor', creating confusion as to which entity is being referred to, leading to uncertain enforcement. Now, the terms 'Client' and 'Customer' could be interpreted as different entities.

perturbation.original_text: Contractor will, pursuant to the written specifications given by Customer and pre approved by Contractor ("Specifications"), perform manufacturing services on behalf of Customer. These manufacturing services shall include, but not be limited to, labor, materials, testing, packaging and delivery to Customer, all subject to the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Service Provider will, pursuant to the written specifications given by Client and pre approved by Manufacturer ("Specifications"), perform manufacturing services on behalf of the Buyer. These manufacturing services shall include, but not be limited to, labor, materials, testing, packaging and delivery to the Buyer, all subject to the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Contractor' to 'Service Provider' and 'Customer' to 'Client' and 'Customer' to 'Buyer' introduces ambiguity. Also, Contractor to 'Manufacturer'. This section now uses 'Service Provider,' 'Manufacturer', 'Client', and 'Buyer' while the original agreement terms were 'Customer' and 'Contractor', leading to uncertainty in enforcement as the actual parties undertaking obligations are unclear.

perturbation.original_text: Customer's product and designs contain certain elements that are proprietary to Customer. Furthermore, in the course of this agreement, technical and commercial information of the Customer may be revealed or become known to the Contractor. Contractor shall keep in confidence all information relating to the foregoing, shall not use any part of it for any purpose except the performance of this Agreement or in connection therewith, and shall not enable any third party to use ft without the prior written consent of Customer or unless such information becomes public domain. Contractor shall ensure that all employees who directly participate in any of the services performed under this Agreement and may accordingly receive certain confidential information of the Customer are subject to similar non-disclosure and non-use undertakings and are made aware of the proprietary and confidential nature of the information.
perturbation.changed_text: Client's product and designs contain certain elements that are proprietary to Client. Furthermore, in the course of this agreement, technical and commercial information of the Buyer may be revealed or become known to the Service Provider. Manufacturer shall keep in confidence all information relating to the foregoing, shall not use any part of it for any purpose except the performance of this Agreement or in connection therewith, and shall not enable any third party to use ft without the prior written consent of Customer or unless such information becomes public domain. Service Provider shall ensure that all employees who directly participate in any of the services performed under this Agreement and may accordingly receive certain confidential information of the Customer are subject to similar non-disclosure and non-use undertakings and are made aware of the proprietary and confidential nature of the information.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Contractor' to 'Service Provider' and 'Customer' to 'Client' and 'Buyer' and 'Manufacturer'introduces ambiguity. The usage of the different terms to describe the same actor will lead to confusion. For example, the mention of the terms 'Client', 'Manufacturer','Customer' and 'Buyer' in the same section to describe the same actor will result in a legal uncertainty with severe material implication.
